turns.speaker: MCCULLOCH
turns.text: You've been coming out here every summer for the last three years, young lady, and you still haven't learned how.

turns.speaker: YOUNG RENNIE
turns.text: I'll take some lessons this time. I promise.

turns.speaker: MCCULLOCH
turns.text: He never learned how either and he's still at the bottom of this lake.

turns.speaker: YOUNG RENNIE
turns.text: He is not.

turns.speaker: MCCULLOCH
turns.text: Oh, he is indeed. And ready to pull down anybody who falls in and can't swim.

turns.speaker: YOUNG RENNIE
turns.text: You're telling a lie.

turns.speaker: MCCULLOCH
turns.text: Am I? Let's find out.

turns.speaker: YOUNG RENNIE
turns.text: I...I can't...

turns.speaker: MCCULLOCH
turns.text: You can and you will! Swim, Rennie!

turns.speaker: MCCULLOCH
turns.text: You're making a big mistake, Rennie. It's not too late to put you back on land.

turns.speaker: RENNIE
turns.text: I'm staying.

turns.speaker: MCCULLOCH
turns.text: If Miss Van Deusen knew how afraid you were of...

turns.speaker: RENNIE
turns.text: She didn't push me into coming.

turns.speaker: MCCULLOCH
turns.text: Why are you doing this to yourself?

turns.speaker: RENNIE
turns.text: I don't even know why I'm afraid, Uncle Charles. I can't even remember when it started. Don't you think it's time I found out and got over it?

turns.speaker: MCCULLOCH
turns.text: Facing your fear doesn't always conquer it.

turns.speaker: RENNIE
turns.text: I'm staying.

turns.speaker: MCCULLOCH
turns.text: You had me worried to death!

turns.speaker: RENNIE
turns.text: But Sean said...

turns.speaker: MCCULLOCH
turns.text: I'm the one you should be listening to! Do you think dropping an anchor in the middle of a storm makes any sense whatsoever?

turns.speaker: RENNIE
turns.text: Can't we at least talk about it?

turns.speaker: MCCULLOCH
turns.text: I refuse to discuss this ridiculous notion that a ghoul is terrorizing this ship.

turns.speaker: RENNIE
turns.text: But what about the drowning boy I've been seeing?

turns.speaker: MCCULLOCH
turns.text: Whatever you've been...imagining... has nothing to do with Jason Voorhees.  I want you to be safe, Rennie. That's all I care about.

turns.speaker: RENNIE
turns.text: I'm not staying in my room, Uncle Charles.

turns.speaker: MCCULLOCH
turns.text: This isn't a request.

turns.speaker: MCCULLOCH
turns.text: Get in the boat, Rennie!

turns.speaker: RENNIE
turns.text: I...I can't...

turns.speaker: MCCULLOCH
turns.text: You can and you will!!

turns.speaker: RENNIE
turns.text: You pushed me...

turns.speaker: MCCULLOCH
turns.text: I was only trying to teach you. But I pulled you out, Rennie. I saved your life.

turns.speaker: MISS VAN DEUSEN
turns.text: I'm glad you decided to come after all.

turns.speaker: RENNIE
turns.text: Me too. But I'm not sure Uncle Charles will be.

turns.speaker: MISS VAN DEUSEN
turns.text: You let me worry about him, okay?  Personal experiences are what fuel the minds of great writers, Rennie. You made the right decision.

turns.speaker: RENNIE
turns.text: What about not-so-great writers?

turns.speaker: MISS VAN DEUSEN
turns.text: Everything okay?

turns.speaker: RENNIE
turns.text: Just felt a little chill.

turns.speaker: MISS VAN DEUSEN
turns.text: Did you know that I'm giving up teaching?

turns.speaker: RENNIE
turns.text: Really?

turns.speaker: MISS VAN DEUSEN
turns.text: Since the school is closing anyway, I'm going to write that novel I've been threatening on everybody.

turns.speaker: RENNIE
turns.text: That's wonderful, Miss Van Deusen...what's it about?

turns.speaker: MISS VAN DEUSEN
turns.text: Stephen King supposedly used it when he was in high school.

turns.speaker: RENNIE
turns.text: I don't know what to say...

turns.speaker: MISS VAN DEUSEN
turns.text: Rennie, you're the best student I ever had...you have a real gift. If anybody can make use of that pen, it's you.

turns.speaker: MISS VAN DEUSEN
turns.text: Rennie -- I was just on my way over to your room

turns.speaker: RENNIE
turns.text: Have you seen my dog anywhere?

turns.speaker: MISS VAN DEUSEN
turns.text: No, but I'm sure Toby's fine. The ship's only so big and there's certainly no way off it, is there?

turns.speaker: MISS VAN DEUSEN
turns.text: So, are you having fun yet?

turns.speaker: RENNIE
turns.text: Yeah...a lot.

turns.speaker: MISS VAN DEUSEN
turns.text: I seem to detect a hint of ingenuousness in your tone.  In other words, level with me.

turns.speaker: RENNIE
turns.text: There's something I haven't told you...

turns.speaker: RENNIE
turns.text: I can't swim.

turns.speaker: MISS VAN DEUSEN
turns.text: I gathered that.

turns.speaker: MISS VAN DEUSEN
turns.text: I had a skiing accident in high school, broke my left leg. It took three winters before I would even look at the snow again...but the solution kept eluding me.  I finally took lessons. I've never broken a bone since.

turns.speaker: RENNIE
turns.text: It's not that simple.

turns.speaker: MISS VAN DEUSEN
turns.text: Maybe not. But you're not telling me everything, are you?

turns.speaker: RENNIE
turns.text: Whenever I get near the water, I see this young boy drowning. He tries to pull me down with him.

turns.speaker: MISS VAN DEUSEN
turns.text: When did this start?

turns.speaker: RENNIE
turns.text: About four years ago...at Crystal Lake. I spent a few summers there with Uncle Charles inbetween boarding school.

turns.speaker: MISS VAN DEUSEN
turns.text: After your parents passed away?

turns.speaker: MISS VAN DEUSEN
turns.text: Did you have an accident in the lake?

turns.speaker: RENNIE
turns.text: No. It was just a normal summer. I've never been able to figure it out.

turns.speaker: MISS VAN DEUSEN
turns.text: Only one young boy ever drowned in that lake, and that was before you were even born. His name was Jason Voorhees.

turns.speaker: SEAN
turns.text: The Captain and Chief Engineer... they've been...they're dead.

turns.speaker: RADIO OFFICER
turns.text: What is your location?

turns.speaker: SEAN
turns.text: I...I don't know...

turns.speaker: RADIO OFFICER
turns.text: Is your ship equipped with Omega satellite navigation or LORAN?

turns.speaker: SEAN
turns.text: Yes...

turns.speaker: RADIO OFFICER
turns.text: The LORAN has a digital printout of your latitude and longitude. Give me the coordinates and we'll be there as quick as we can.

turns.speaker: SEAN
turns.text: I've got the numbers.

turns.speaker: RADIO OFFICER
turns.text: Give me the degrees first, followed by minutes and sec...

turns.speaker: SEAN
turns.text: Rennie...

turns.speaker: RENNIE
turns.text: Hi, Sean.

turns.speaker: SEAN
turns.text: I heard you weren't coming.

turns.speaker: RENNIE
turns.text: We changed our minds.

turns.speaker: SEAN
turns.text: I got you a present.

turns.speaker: RENNIE
turns.text: But I didn't get you one...

turns.speaker: SEAN
turns.text: Forget it. It's a dumb little thing anyway.

turns.speaker: SEAN
turns.text: I thought maybe we could hike to the top of the Statue when we got there, if you felt like it. It's supposed to be 22 stories tall.

turns.speaker: RENNIE
turns.text: I'd love to.

turns.speaker: SEAN
turns.text: It's okay...you're going to be okay.

turns.speaker: RENNIE
turns.text: I want to go home. I want off this ship.

turns.speaker: RENNIE
turns.text: Can he really take us home?

turns.speaker: SEAN
turns.text: Not completing a voyage is against everything he stands for. But I think I can convince him to call a Coast Guard cutter for you.

turns.speaker: RENNIE
turns.text: What about you?

turns.speaker: SEAN
turns.text: If I go with you, he'll never speak to me again.  But I'm never going to live up to his expectations anyway...so maybe it's the right thing to do.

turns.speaker: SEAN
turns.text: I don't know...we've gone off course or something...

turns.speaker: RENNIE
turns.text: What do you mean???

turns.speaker: SEAN
turns.text: I think so. But we have to lower the anchors so we don't drift any further...

turns.speaker: RENNIE
turns.text: Where are they?

turns.speaker: SEAN
turns.text: The bow...front of the ship. There's a hoist on each side that lowers them

turns.speaker: SEAN
turns.text: I didn't mean for you to go!

turns.speaker: RENNIE
turns.text: Just radio for help, okay???

turns.speaker: SEAN
turns.text: Rennie...??

turns.speaker: RENNIE
turns.text: The window...

turns.speaker: SEAN
turns.text: Rule one, don't panic. Rule two, assess the damage and act accordingly...

turns.speaker: RENNIE
turns.text: Is the ship going to sink??

turns.speaker: SEAN
turns.text: We'll be okay. I want you to wait by the lifeboats, just in case.

turns.speaker: RENNIE
turns.text: I'm not going near any lifeboat!

turns.speaker: SEAN
turns.text: But Rennie...

turns.speaker: RENNIE
turns.text: I'm not!!

turns.speaker: SEAN
turns.text: Rennie...what'd they do to you??

turns.speaker: RENNIE
turns.text: Drugs...  Then Jason came. He's here, Sean.

turns.speaker: SEAN
turns.text: You have to call the police...

turns.speaker: RENNIE
turns.text: Please, hurry...

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: I used to drive a taxi.

turns.speaker: DRIVER
turns.text: Where you're going, mister?

turns.speaker: DRIVER
turns.text: I used to be head of neurosurgery. Big hospital in USSR. This hospital, I'm not kidding.

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: Very big.

turns.speaker: DRIVER
turns.text: I opened thousands of brains.

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: What did you find?

turns.speaker: DRIVER
turns.text: Big mess every time.

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: I loved my taxi. Went twelve hours nonstop. Stopped only to pee. I peed under the Manhattan bridge. Peed many times in parks and playgrounds.

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: I wrapped my sandwiches in tinfoil. I ate and drove. I had one of those big checkered cabs.

turns.speaker: DRIVER
turns.text: You are going where?

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: Crosstown.

turns.speaker: DRIVER
turns.text: Very bad today.

turns.speaker: DRIVER
turns.text: We must abandon.

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: What do you mean, we must abandon?

turns.speaker: DRIVER
turns.text: Ruptured steam pipe.

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: We must abandon.

turns.speaker: DRIVER
turns.text: Contaminated substance. Very dangerous. Shooting mud.

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: Do not inhale.

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: I never left the garage without my Windex.

turns.speaker: DRIVER
turns.text: I was barrister in Kenya. I said to him, get off from here. I cannot drive with your body on my windscreen.

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: I drove twelve hours straight through. Ate at the wheel.

turns.speaker: DRIVER
turns.text: Under the Manhattan Bridge.

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: That's where I peed.

turns.speaker: PAISLEY
turns.text: Guys ready to order?

turns.speaker: ELLIOT
turns.text: Paisley Porter. I didn't know you were waiting tables.

turns.speaker: PAISLEY
turns.text: Elliot?

turns.speaker: ELLIOT
turns.text: This is a great young out-of-work actress.

turns.speaker: PAISLEY
turns.text: Elliot Litvak. Have you been ill? And Mr. Rogan. How nice.

turns.speaker: ELLIOT
turns.text: Say it again.

turns.speaker: PAISLEY
turns.text: Alla puttanesca.

turns.speaker: ELLIOT
turns.text: Isn't she great? What did I tell you? A talent.

turns.speaker: ELLIOT
turns.text: Nicky. I was thinking about you. I went to the preview last night.

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: I don't want to hear about it.

turns.speaker: ELLIOT
turns.text: A lovely piece of theater. Small but important.

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: Shut up, Elliot.

turns.speaker: ELLIOT
turns.text: Quietly effective.

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: You're an artist. I'm a craftsman.

turns.speaker: ELLIOT
turns.text: Press a button and they give us money.

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: Ride with me. We need a haircut.

turns.speaker: ELLIOT
turns.text: How is Lillian? I haven't seen her.

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: She wants a divorce.

turns.speaker: ELLIOT
turns.text: Don't talk like that.

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: It's over, finished and done with.

turns.speaker: ELLIOT
turns.text: That sounds so final. But are we really surprised?

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: I'm completely stunned. I don't want this to happen.

turns.speaker: ELLIOT
turns.text: But didn't we know it would happen?

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: Don't needle me, Elliot. Tell me how bad you feel. We're suppose to feel bad together. This is what friends do.

turns.speaker: ELLIOT
turns.text: Joanna Bourne. So rich and crisp. This woman lets you touch her body? You put your hands on her personal parts?

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: Very dangerous.

turns.speaker: ELLIOT
turns.text: Asbestos lining.

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: We must abandon.

turns.speaker: ELLIOT
turns.text: Do not inhale.

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: I'm trying to think. When did you start looking so terrible? You look awful.

turns.speaker: ELLIOT
turns.text: I can tell you the year, the day, the night, the minute.

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: You used to love life. You don't exude this any more.

turns.speaker: ELLIOT
turns.text: What do I exude?

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: Suffering. You exude a person who sits in a small dark apartment eating soft white bread.

turns.speaker: ELLIOT
turns.text: Tonight you find out what it means to suffer.

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: Tonight. What's tonight?

turns.speaker: ELLIOT
turns.text: Shit. They don't have any carrot soup.

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: You mean because What's-His-Name.

turns.speaker: ELLIOT
turns.text: You will suffer because he is in the theater. And you will suffer a thousandfold when his review appears.

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: It's just a review.

turns.speaker: ELLIOT
turns.text: It is just a review. Do not inhale. Very dangerous.

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: What's the fuss? I don't get it.

turns.speaker: ELLIOT
turns.text: That's what I said eighteen months ago.

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: What happened eighteen months ago?

turns.speaker: ELLIOT
turns.text: Before his Broadway days. He reviewed the one-act I did at the Fulton Fish Market. We did this play at four AM, outdoors in the rain. One performance. For the fish handlers.

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: And he was there?

turns.speaker: ELLIOT
turns.text: Steven Schwimmer. I memorized every word of this review.

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: That's awful.

turns.speaker: ELLIOT
turns.text: I recite it to myself with masochistic relish.

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: A year and a half later? You're still brooding?

turns.speaker: ELLIOT
turns.text: Do you want me to tell you what it was like, reading that review at the newstand with trucks rumbling past and street vendors facing Mecca?

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: What was it like?

turns.speaker: ELLIOT
turns.text: I said, `I'm dead'. He killed me.

turns.speaker: ELLIOT
turns.text: Is it safe?

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: Do we care?

turns.speaker: ELLIOT
turns.text: I think we Nought to wait.

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: I say we go.

turns.speaker: ELLIOT
turns.text: You say we go?

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: Do not inhale.

turns.speaker: ELLIOT
turns.text: I'm not ready.

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: Here we go.

turns.speaker: ELLIOT
turns.text: The man has taken over my mind. He's not only out there. He's in my head and I can't get rid of him. I can't write a word without imagining his response. I'm paralyzed as an artist.

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: I don't have the problems that artists have.

turns.speaker: ELLIOT
turns.text: Where are you going?

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: Don't wait Efor me.

turns.speaker: ELLIOT
turns.text: What about the haircut?

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: He carries a gun.

turns.speaker: ELLIOT
turns.text: Then you should carry a gun.

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: I used to carry a gun when I drove a cab.

turns.speaker: ELLIOT
turns.text: Where is it?

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: I gave it away. I thought, I'm a writer now.

turns.speaker: ELLIOT
turns.text: That was a big mistake.

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: We're making too much of this.

turns.speaker: ELLIOT
turns.text: No, we're not.

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: I'm not a lonely spooky writer like you. Nursing a hundred grudges. I'm a man who loves life.

turns.speaker: ELLIOT
turns.text: We're talking about something deeper than grudges. How do we respond to personal attack?

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: In other words why should we suffer silently at this kind of abuse? The man is out there ruining lives.

turns.speaker: ELLIOT
turns.text: It's your best play, Nicky.

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: He'll hate it.

turns.speaker: ELLIOT
turns.text: He'll kill it. He'll write a review so devastating it will shatter your career and cause the most unmanageable psychic grief. What happens to your apartment on the East River? Your house in Connecticut, where you watch things grow.

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: We were thinking of putting in a pool.

turns.speaker: ELLIOT
turns.text: `The most interesting thing about Elliot Litvak is that he writes the way he looks -- fuzzy, grubby and shifty-eyed.'  I'm telling you as a friend.

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: ELLIOT
turns.text: There are things that speak to us from the past.

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: Shoot him.

turns.speaker: ELLIOT
turns.text: The American theater doesn't need people like that.

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: Shoot him, Nicky. Not that we really mean it. But where does he live?

turns.speaker: ELLIOT
turns.text: Keep going west. Last building before the river.

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: How do you Eknow.

turns.speaker: ELLIOT
turns.text: Paisley Porter.

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: What do you mean?

turns.speaker: ELLIOT
turns.text: About an hour and a half ago. I saw her come out of a place. She said she was visiting a friend. But she wouldn't tell me who.

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: Had to be him.

turns.speaker: ELLIOT
turns.text: She was very evasive.

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: Great game.

turns.speaker: FIRST MAN
turns.text: Unbelievable.

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: Classic.

turns.speaker: FIRST MAN
turns.text: I think you're a little confused. Nothing personal friend.

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: What are you talking about?

turns.speaker: FIRST MAN
turns.text: What are we talking about?

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: Yes. What are you implying?

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: Of course I saw it.

turns.speaker: FIRST MAN
turns.text: Did you see the winning run score?

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: You're not making sense. Make sense.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: This could be it.

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: This could be it.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Let's work on it.

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: Let's work on it.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: This could Pbe it.

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: This could be it.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: This could be it.

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: This could be it.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: This could be it.

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: This could be it.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Does it feel comfortable?

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: Does what feel comfortable?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: This could be it.

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: This could be it.

turns.speaker: JOANNA
turns.text: Last night. Alan Albright called me a handsome woman. Second time he's done that. Son of a bitch.

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: I hear Alan's sick.

turns.speaker: JOANNA
turns.text: Alan's very sick. He has to go to New Mexico and sit in a lukewarm solution.

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: You know about Adele.

turns.speaker: JOANNA
turns.text: What about her?

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: She's dying.

turns.speaker: JOANNA
turns.text: She died.

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: I talked to her two days ago.

turns.speaker: JOANNA
turns.text: Apparently it didn't help. You know about Peter, of course.

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: Our Peter?

turns.speaker: JOANNA
turns.text: Peter Redmond. They found out why he can't remember his lines. There's something living in his brain. A parasite he picked up in Borneo, doing the movie.

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: Can he get through it?

turns.speaker: JOANNA
turns.text: They're watching him closely. There's a special rehearsal set for this afternoon. To bolster his confidence. And that's not all.

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: I've got bigger problems, Joanna. Personal problems.

turns.speaker: JOANNA
turns.text: That's not all, Nicky. I've been backing your plays for fifteen years. And I've never been more depressed.

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: About what?

turns.speaker: JOANNA
turns.text: Steven Schwimmer. The most powerful critic in America gets his first crack at Nicky Rogan.

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: Look. All I want is a haircut. I'm not worried about this guy.

turns.speaker: JOANNA
turns.text: Ever since he started reviewing the Broadway theater, nobody in this business has been worried about anything else.

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: They can send their heartless brilliant boy-critic. There's a much bigger thing going on than tonight's opening.

turns.speaker: JOANNA
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: The Red Sox

turns.speaker: JOANNA
turns.text: You mean the World Series? I thought the Red Sox were winning.

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: Three games to two. But if you know their history, you realize there's a tragedy in the making. I've been carrying this franchise on my back since I was six years old.

turns.speaker: JOANNA
turns.text: It can't be all that personal.

turns.speaker: JOANNA
turns.text: I'm proud of this play. It's so different from anything you've done.

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: This is how we've managed to last.

turns.speaker: JOANNA
turns.text: We're able to surprise each other.

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: In and out of bed.

turns.speaker: JOANNA
turns.text: Because we're completely mismatched.

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: We don't even like each other, do we?

turns.speaker: JOANNA
turns.text: I used to tell myself. Talent is more erotic when it's wasted. Will I see you tonight?

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: The Red Sox blow a chance to win their first World Series since 1918. You expect me to miss that for an opening night?

turns.speaker: JOANNA
turns.text: It makes me so mad. Steven Schwimmer ready to strike. The exterminating angel.

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: It's all worked out. They'll lose tonight. Then they'll lose tomorrow. I see it with stunning clarity.

turns.speaker: JOANNA
turns.text: It's your best play, Nicky.

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: They'll lose because they're my team.

turns.speaker: JOANNA
turns.text: He will absolutely hate it.

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: I never see you anymore. Where are you all day?

turns.speaker: LAUREL
turns.text: I go to college. I thought you knew.

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: Do you want to get some coffee?

turns.speaker: LAUREL
turns.text: I don't drink coffee, Daddy. And this is not what we should be talking about.

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: What do you want to talk about? I'll talk about anything. What's this?

turns.speaker: LAUREL
turns.text: I'm seeing your play tonight, remember?

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: Why do you need a radio?

turns.speaker: LAUREL
turns.text: So at the intermission I can listen to the ball game. Do you know that mother is seeing a prominent divorce lawyer?

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: That's completely crazy.

turns.speaker: LAUREL
turns.text: Is it?

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: Don't talk like that. How prominent? What are you implying?

turns.speaker: LAUREL
turns.text: She's doing like those Iranians. `I divorce thee. I divorce thee. I divorce thee'

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: And he hears it the same time I hear it? What happened to family secrets?

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: If lawyers for the mob are called controversial, why are divorce lawyers called prominent?

turns.speaker: LAUREL
turns.text: Because they get outstanding settlements. And Mother is determined that this time there's no turning back.

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: I just had breakfast with her. She didn't say a word about this.

turns.speaker: LAUREL
turns.text: Because you refuse to believe she's serious. You've always refused.

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: Don't be so steely-eyed. It's that course you're taking in criminology.

turns.speaker: LAUREL
turns.text: Oh please. Not now.  She wants you to stop seeing What's- Her-Name. Finally. Now and forever. Do you think that's too much to ask? For a wife of nineteen years.

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: You're too young to be studying criminal behavior. It's making you obsessive.

turns.speaker: LAUREL
turns.text: She is kicking you out.

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: Your mother and I have something between us that's too strong to damage permanently. Believe me, I know this. That's right, nineteen years. And what about the days and minutes? Sharing small moments, sharing memories, raising a beautiful child. We're wedded in the deepest and strongest ways. Lillian isn't only my wife. She's my best friend.

turns.speaker: LAUREL
turns.text: Mother won't tell me how long you've been seeing this person. She's embarrassed to tell me. So why don't you tell me?

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: Don't call her Mother all the time. It makes her sound tragic and unforgiving. What happened to Mom?

turns.speaker: LAUREL
turns.text: I didn't turn her into Mother. You did.

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: This person and I are a thing of the total past. I promise you.

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: Laurel. Tickets are all set. I double-checked.

turns.speaker: LAUREL
turns.text: Thanks, Daddy. But I just need one. Mother's not going.

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: Opening night?

turns.speaker: LAUREL
turns.text: I know -- why should a bitter divorce interfere with tradition?

turns.speaker: LAUREL
turns.text: Rogan, Laurel. You also have a Rogan, Lillian. She won't need it. Sell it.

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: Take it yourself. Take a date.

turns.speaker: LAUREL
turns.text: I don't have a date. I don't want a date.

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: And you blame me. It's because we never talk. Let's talk.

turns.speaker: LAUREL
turns.text: I have a class. I'm late.

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: Can we talk later? Will you be at the party?

turns.speaker: LAUREL
turns.text: I'm not sure.

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: Look. I'm sorry you keep running into dishonest men. But you're only eighteen. We can still turn it around.

turns.speaker: LAUREL
turns.text: Except I won't have a father anymore.

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: I'll see you all the time. I'll get a place right nearby. One room. No distractions. We'll talk.

turns.speaker: LAUREL
turns.text: What will we talk about?

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: Everything.

turns.speaker: LAUREL
turns.text: Will I believe you when you tell me something?

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: There's nothing left for me to lie about.

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: I see the outline of your body in chalk on this very floor.

turns.speaker: LAUREL
turns.text: Daddy, wait.

turns.speaker: LAUREL
turns.text: Why won't you tell me your name?

turns.speaker: STEVEN
turns.text: It's only our first date.

turns.speaker: LAUREL
turns.text: I'm willing to tell you my name.

turns.speaker: STEVEN
turns.text: Names are incredibly intimate. We barely know each other. Trust me on this.

turns.speaker: LAUREL
turns.text: You have to tell me what you thought of the play.

turns.speaker: STEVEN
turns.text: First you tell me.

turns.speaker: LAUREL
turns.text: Brilliantly moving.

turns.speaker: STEVEN
turns.text: What else?

turns.speaker: LAUREL
turns.text: Packs an emotional wallop.

turns.speaker: STEVEN
turns.text: What else?

turns.speaker: LAUREL
turns.text: A flat-out hit.

turns.speaker: STEVEN
turns.text: If you're wondering about the firearm.

turns.speaker: LAUREL
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: STEVEN
turns.text: This building is not secure.

turns.speaker: LAUREL
turns.text: I have this thing where I have to know a person is being honest with me before, you know, I can feel completely free to be myself.

turns.speaker: STEVEN
turns.text: We're strangers in the night. The last thing we want is honesty.

turns.speaker: LAUREL
turns.text: What do we want?

turns.speaker: STEVEN
turns.text: Mystery. Deception.

turns.speaker: LAUREL
turns.text: Deception isn't something I personally consider sexy.

turns.speaker: STEVEN
turns.text: What's sexy?

turns.speaker: LAUREL
turns.text: Knowing who a person is. Down deep.

turns.speaker: STEVEN
turns.text: Even if the truth about a person is sad or depressing or shocking?

turns.speaker: LAUREL
turns.text: You won't even tell me your name. What's shocking about a name?

turns.speaker: STEVEN
turns.text: Am I really so deeply repugnant?

turns.speaker: LAUREL
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: LAUREL
turns.text: Yes. And no more evasive tactics.

turns.speaker: STEVEN
turns.text: It's your best play, Nicky.

turns.speaker: LAUREL
turns.text: See, Daddy.

turns.speaker: STEVEN
turns.text: I've seen it twice. I went back tonight to be sure. It's a brave and honest piece of work.

turns.speaker: LAUREL
turns.text: What else?

turns.speaker: STEVEN
turns.text: An artistry and sensitivity you've never shown before.

turns.speaker: LAUREL
turns.text: See, Daddy.

turns.speaker: STEVEN
turns.text: And Peter Redmond helped immensely. These pauses were exquisitely timed. He made us wait and wait. He built a gorgeous tension and suspense.

turns.speaker: LILLIAN
turns.text: Your father said you might be here.

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: Two-all after six.

turns.speaker: LILLIAN
turns.text: I've been looking for you because I want to let you know what's been going on before you read about it in a gossip column.

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: We stranded five runners in the first two innings. This will come back to haunt us.

turns.speaker: LILLIAN
turns.text: I want to be fair-minded, Nicky.

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: All right. What's been going on?

turns.speaker: LILLIAN
turns.text: I've been talking to a prominent divorce lawyer.

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: How prominent?

turns.speaker: LILLIAN
turns.text: He has his own submarine. I'll be getting everything that matters. I'll get New York and I'll get Connecticut.

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: I'll have whatever she's having.

turns.speaker: LILLIAN
turns.text: I don't want to be responsible for his food. Just a small green salad. And a Perrier.

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: Bring me the bay scallops with mercury poisoning.

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: Opening night, Lillian.

turns.speaker: LILLIAN
turns.text: Who the hell cares?

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: The whole thing is my fault. I took unfair advantage of your patience and understanding. You understand me.

turns.speaker: LILLIAN
turns.text: That's always been my problem.

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: And you've been extremely patient.

turns.speaker: LILLIAN
turns.text: You know why, don't you? Because I am patient, chain-smoking Lillian.

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: You smoked because I smoked. We were falling in love, remember? I used to see certain movies only because you had seen them. I wanted to see what you saw.

turns.speaker: LILLIAN
turns.text: I'd forgotten that.

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: I went because you went. You smoked because I smoked.

turns.speaker: LILLIAN
turns.text: That's very lovely actually.

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: Laurel wants us to be honest and open. Let's be open with each other.

turns.speaker: LILLIAN
turns.text: Be open with me. I'd like that.

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: There may be things you'd rather not know about.

turns.speaker: LILLIAN
turns.text: I want to know. We haven't talked this way in years.

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: I had an affair -- are you sure you want to hear this?

turns.speaker: LILLIAN
turns.text: Joanne Bourne.

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: Alma Wetzel.

turns.speaker: LILLIAN
turns.text: Nicky, no. This is insupportable. How could you?

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: I'm a man. She's, you know, a woman.

turns.speaker: LILLIAN
turns.text: She's my gynecologist.

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: I am really, deeply sorry.

turns.speaker: LILLIAN
turns.text: It violates so many trusts.

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: It was an animal thing. No real intimacy.

turns.speaker: LILLIAN
turns.text: I never thought of Dr. Wetzel as having a sex life outside the office.

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: We did it in the office. She thought her apartment was too impersonal.

turns.speaker: LILLIAN
turns.text: I'm glad we're having this talk.

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: I feel great. I feel impeccably alive. I'm elated. Eat something. Please. I love you.

turns.speaker: MATTHEW
turns.text: What happens if somebody comes in here right now and shoots you?

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: This place becomes famous. Tour buses. Blind people feeling around for bullet holes in the wall.

turns.speaker: MATTHEW
turns.text: What's it like to shoot somebody?

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: I respect a kid who does his homework in a taxi. But let's put a lid on the questions.

turns.speaker: MATTHEW
turns.text: Great game. Red Sox are winning.

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: They're always winning. Until they lose.

turns.speaker: MATTHEW
turns.text: Life is good.

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: Life is good.

turns.speaker: MATTHEW
turns.text: People are dependable.

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: I don't know if I can say that.
